text: Aspergillus umbrosus (also named A. glaucus) is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Aspergillus section. The species was first described in 1912. Bainier, G.; Sartory, A. 1912. Étude biologique and morphologique de certains Aspergillus. Bulletin de la Société Mycologique de France. 28(3):257-269 It has been reported to produce asperflavin, auroglaucin, bisanthrons, dihydroauroglaucin, echinulins, emodin, epiheveadrides, erythroglaucin, flavoglaucin, isoechinulins, neoechinulins, physcion, questin, questinol, tetracyclic, and tetrahydroauroglaucin. == References == umbrosus Category:Fungi described in 1912
title: Aspergillus umbrosus
